t: Nahum 3
Nineveh’s Complete Ruin
Woe*pn to the bloody city, completely full of lies and*i pillage; Her*iln prey never departs.
The*ln noise of the whip, The*ln noise of the rattling of the wheel, Galloping*ln horses And*ln bounding chariots!
Horsemen*ln charging, Swords*ln flashing, spears gleaming, Many*ln slain, a mass of corpses, And*ln countless dead bodies— They*ln stumble over the dead bodies!
All*iln because of the many harlotries of the harlot, The*ln charming one, the mistress of sorceries, Who*ln sells nations by her harlotries And*ln families by her sorceries.
“Behold,*ln I am against you,” declares the Lord*s of hosts; “And*ln I will lift up your skirts over your face, And*ln show to the nations your nakedness And*ln to the kingdoms your disgrace.
I*ln will throw filth on you And*ln make you vile, And*ln set you up as a spectacle.
And*ln it will come about that all who see you Will*ln shrink from you and say, ‘Nineveh*ln is devastated! Who*ln will grieve for her?’ Where*ln will I seek comforters for you?”
Are*ln you better than No-amon, Which*ln was situated by the waters of the Nile, With*ln water surrounding her, Whose*ln rampart was*i the sea, Whose*ln wall consisted*i of the sea?
Ethiopia*ln was her*i might, And*ln Egypt too, without limits. Put*ln and Lubim were among her helpers.

Yet*ln she became an exile, She*ln went into captivity; Also*ln her small children were dashed to pieces At*ln the head of every street; They*ln cast lots for her honorable men, And*ln all her great men were bound with fetters.
You*ln too will become drunk, You*ln will be hidden. You*ln too will search for a refuge from the enemy.
All*ln your fortifications are fig trees with ripe fruit— When*ln shaken, they fall into the eater’s mouth.
Behold,*ln your people are women in your midst! The*ln gates of your land are opened wide to your enemies; Fire*ln consumes your gate bars.
Draw*ln for yourself water for the siege! Strengthen*ln your fortifications! Go*ln into the clay and tread the mortar! Take*ln hold of the brick mold!

There*ln fire will consume you, The*ln sword will cut you down; It*ln will consume you as the locust does.*i Multiply*bln yourself like the creeping locust, Multiply*ln yourself like the swarming locust.
You*ln have increased your traders more than the stars of heaven— The*ln creeping locust strips and flies away.

Your*ln guardsmen are like the swarming locust. Your*ln marshals are like hordes of grasshoppers Settling*ln in the stone walls on a cold day. The*ln sun rises and they flee, And*ln the place where they are is not known.
Your*ln shepherds are sleeping, O king of Assyria; Your*ln nobles are lying down. Your*ln people are scattered on the mountains And*ln there is no one to regather them.*i
There*ln is no relief for your breakdown, Your*ln wound is incurable. All*ln who hear about you Will*ln clap their*i hands over you, For*ln on whom has not your evil passed continually?
